term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - change of a quantity
term.title: change of a quantity

item.text: The increment of the value of a quantity Q with time. The change may be expressed either infinitesimally at time t by the differential dQ or dQ(t), or in practice it may be expressed by a finite increment over the time interval t1;t2, i.e. Q(t2) - Q(t1), which may be written Δ Q or ΔQ(t1;t2) ΔQ = ΔQ(t1;t2) = Q(t2) - Q(t1); amount of substance change, Δn; volume change, ΔV; substance concentration change, Δc.

sources.item: PAC, 1992, 64, 1569. 'Quantities and units for metabolic processes as a function of time (IUPAC Recommendations 1992)' on page 1571 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199264101569)
